I've been trying to get either version to run "make" and work.  Right
now, =
with cantera-1.6.0r2 I'm getting a bundle of mess that starts
with this:

c=
d Cantera/cxx/src; make
make[1]: Entering directory
`/auto/grp4/HMX_propell=
ants/cantera-1.6.0r2/Cantera/cxx/src'
g++ -c cxxutils.cpp -I../../src   -O3=
 -Wall
In file included from State.h:22,
                 from Phase.h:16,
=
                 from ThermoPhase.h:20,
                 from cxxutils.cpp:=
7:
ct_defs.h:52: error: `doublereal' does not name a type

The same error i=
s coming up in multiple header and cpp files listed
afterwards.  

By the w=
ay, is this the right place to be asking questions like this?
 Just want to=
 make sure I'm not wasting anyone's time.  Thanks.

Dan

hoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...> wrote:

> Dan,
> 
> I too am f=
inding a problem building on linux, but it is a little

he problem you describe. However, it occurs at the  
> same point - trying =
to link demos.cpp.
> 
> On my machine:
> uname -m=3Di686
> uname -r=3D2.6.1=
1-1.1369_FC4
> uname-s=3DLinux
> 
> I checked out a fresh working copy of C=
antera, and edited the  
> 'preconfig' script only to turn off using sundia=
ls. I then ran:
> 
> ./predef
> make
> 
> For me, the problem is that the s=
ystem does not seem to be able to  
> find the "stdc++" libraries.  If I sp=
ecify the library as "-lstdc++"  
> the build fails, and the functions it s=
ays it can't find are ones in  
> this library.  If I explicitly add file "=
/usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6" to  
> the build command line, then the build of t=
he demo program succeeds.
> 
> I don't think this is a Cantera error, since=
 I believe specifying "- 
> lstdc++" should cause the linker to look for bo=
th static (.a) and  
> dynamic (.so) libraries.  But I don't know what caus=
es it.  I will  
> explore a bit more.
> 
> I don't know if this error has =
the same cause as the one you are  
> getting.  I would recommend checking =
out a fresh version (rather than  
> updating from CVS) and trying to build=
.
> 
> Any linux gurus out there know what is going on here?
> 
> (For what=
 it is worth, this problem seems to be specific to linux; I  
> don't encou=
nter any problem building Cantera on Mac OSX, either on  
> Intel or PPC ma=
chines.)
> 
> Dave
